intro: Alternanthera australis, commonly known as the red sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive red or pink flowers and its ability to thrive in sandy soils. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers. Alternanthera australis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
